title: Andhra Pradesh Excise Department fixes bar licence fee for 3-star and above hotels at ₹5 lakh per annum
content: A non-refundable registration charge of ₹20 lakh per annum will also be levied, according to a G.O.;  the order comes into force with effect from September 1, 2025

title: KMC meet passes several resolutions after heated exchanges between YSRCP, TDP member
content: YSRCP members express their resentment over non-implementation of resolutions passed by the general body earlier

title: President Murmu attends funeral Mass of Pope Francis
content: President Murmu reached Vatican City on Friday on a two-day visit to offer condolences on behalf of the Government and people of India

title: Six nabbed for theft at APSRTC depot manager’s house in Kurnool
content: The accused, which includes five minors, committed the offence by learning to break open the locks of houses through YouTube, says police

title: Women increasingly used as carriers of hybrid ganja smuggled from Bangkok
content: In the last few months alone, around 15 instances of smuggling accounting for 30kg to 40kg of hybrid ganja intercepted at the Kochi airport

title: A.P. govt. appoints P.V. Chalapathi Rao to probe tree-felling in Divaramam Eco Park
content: He will examine the extent of damage and the roles and responsibilities of officials involved in the clearing and tree-felling operations reported in the park

title: 'Maybe Putin doesn't want to stop war,' says Trump after meet with Zelenskyy
content: Donald Trump criticised Vladimir Putin for attacks on Ukrainian civilian areas, suggesting a change in approach through sanctions. This came after Trump's meeting with Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Rome, their first in-person encounter since February. Putin, meanwhile, expressed willingness for talks with Ukraine without preconditions during a meeting with a US envoy.

title: J&K villagers turn to 'Modi bunkers' as fears grow of India-Pak conflict
content: Following the recent terror attack in Pahalgam, residents in the remote border villages of Poonch, Jammu and Kashmir, are preparing their underground bunkers, locally known as "Modi bunkers." These bunkers, built during Prime Minister Modi's tenure to protect civilians from cross-border shelling, are being restocked with essentials.

title: 4 killed, over 500 injured after massive explosion in southern Iran's port
content: A massive explosion at Rajaei port in Bandar Abbas, Iran, injured at least 280 people, sending a plume of smoke into the sky. The blast's cause remains unconfirmed, but it occurred at a port handling container shipments, oil tanks, and petrochemical facilities. The incident happened amidst ongoing nuclear negotiations between Iran and the United States in Oman.

title: Elon Musk replies to JD Vance's family photos from Taj Mahal: One of the ...
content: US Vice President JD Vance, accompanied by his family, recently visited the Taj Mahal during a four-day trip to India. Vance shared photos on X, with Elon Musk commenting on the monument's beauty. The family's visit included a warm welcome from Uttar Pradesh's Chief Minister and stringent security measures along their route.

title: Single? Dating? Gill sets the record straight on his relationship status
content: Shubman Gill, the Indian and Gujarat Titans batter, has dismissed rumours about his relationships, labeling them as "ridiculous." In an interview, the 25-year-old clarified he's been single for over three years, attributing the gossip to his demanding cricketing schedule. Gill emphasised his focus on his career, stating that his time on the road leaves little room for relationships.

title: India lifted 171m people from extreme poverty in 11 years: World Bank
content: The World Bank reports India lifted 171 million people out of extreme poverty between 2011-12 and 2022-23, reducing it to 2.3%. Using a $3.65/day poverty line, 378 million were lifted out of poverty. While significant progress occurred, challenges remain, including youth unemployment and gender disparities in employment, despite rising employment rates.

title: Tesla CEO Musk is not 'happy', says 'We should have been...'
content: Elon Musk expressed his disappointment that humans haven't reached Mars yet, despite SpaceX's efforts. He referenced the rapid progress from the first flight to the moon landing, highlighting the current delay in space exploration.

title: 'Virat Kohli, Anushka Sharma moved to London because ...'
content: Dr. Sriram Nene revealed Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma's move to London. The couple sought to escape constant media attention in India. They desired a more private life for their family. Despite the move, Virat Kohli continues his cricket career. He recently achieved a record in the IPL. He scored his 26th half-century at M Chinnaswamy Stadium.

title: 'If you leave now ... ': J&K CM's message for tourists after Pahalgam attack
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26, Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah has urged tourists to remain in the region, emphasizing that their departure would fulfill the attackers' goals. He acknowledged tourists' fears but assured them of support and instructed officials to assist those wishing to relocate.

title: Shastri issues warning for Vaibhav Suryavanshi: 'There will be failures'
content: Ravi Shastri has lauded the emergence of promising young batsmen in the IPL. He specifically mentioned Ayush Mhatre, Vaibhav Suryavanshi, Priyansh Arya, and Prabhsimran Singh. Shastri highlighted their fearless approach and potential for international cricket. He advised caution regarding Suryavanshi, anticipating increased challenges for the young player. Shastri urged selectors to capitalise on current form when choosing players.

title: ‘I’m doing the work’: Melinda Gates responds to Musk, Bezos' ex-wife criticism
content: Melinda Gates addressed criticisms from tech leaders like Elon Musk and MacKenzie Scott regarding her philanthropic endeavors, emphasizing her commitment to impactful work through the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation and Pivotal Ventures.

title: 4 Killed, 500 Injured In Massive Explosion At Iran's Most Advanced Port
content: Mehrdad Hassanzadeh, head of the province's crisis management authority has confirmed to state tv that the cause of the incident was the explosion of several containers.

title: Opinion: Opinion | When Terror Struck Paradise: What Comes After Pahalgam
content: Any analysis of the heinous terrorist attack at Pahalgam must begin with an outright condemnation and a deep expression of regret for the loss of innocent lives in the most brutal manner.

title: Government Issues Advisory On Media Reporting Of Defence Operations
content: The Ministry of Information and Broadcasting on Saturday issued an advisory directing all media outlets to refrain from broadcasting live coverage of military operations or movements of security forces.

title: Trump, Zelensky Meet At Pope's Funeral Weeks After White House Clash
content: "The meeting took place and is already over," Zelensky's spokesman Sergiy Nykyforov told journalists without elaborating.

title: Union Minister's "No Water" Response To Bilawal Bhutto's "Blood" Threat
content: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri today issued a sharp response to Pakistan Peoples Party (PPP) chief Bilawal Bhutto-Zardari's recent remarks on India's suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty (IWT) following the Pahalgam terror attack on Tuesday.

title: "Not Even A Drop...": How India Plans To Stem Flow Of Indus Water To Pak
content: Emphasising the importance of suspending the Indus Waters Treaty, Union Jal Shakti Minister CR Patil has said India will ensure that not even a "drop of water" from the Indus river goes to Pakistan.

title: Pahalgam Attack Updates: Pak PM's Remark On Pahalgam "Tragedy" Amid Tensions With India
content: Pahalgam terror attack updates: Tensions between India and Pakistan have soared after a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir left 26 people dead this week.

title: Elon Musk's "End Slaughter" Post After Trump Says Russia, Ukraine "Very Close To Deal"
content: After US President Donald Trump claimed that Russia and Ukraine were "very close to a deal," his billionaire adviser, Elon Musk, asserted it was time to end the war.

title: 2 Senior Murshidabad Police Officials Transferred Days After Violent Protests
content: The West Bengal government on Friday announced the replacement of the current police superintendents in both the police districts of minority--dominated Murshidabad district, which had been on the boil earlier this month following communal violence.

title: "Pakistan Ready For...": Shehbaz Sharif Reacts To Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif today said he his ready for a "neutral investigation" of the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam where 26 people, including a Nepalese national, were gunned down.

title: Team Trump Likely Deported US Girl, 2, "With No Meaningful Process": Judge
content: The Trump administration appeared to have deported a 2-year-old US citizen "with no meaningful process," a federal judge said on Friday, as the child's father sought to have her returned to the United States.

title: Hamas Says Open To Freeing Hostages, Five-Year Truce In Gaza
content: Hamas is open to an agreement to end the Gaza war that would include the one-time release of all remaining hostages and a five-year cessation of hostilities, an official from the Palestinian group said Saturday.

title: More Than 1,000 Illegal Bangladeshi Immigrants Detained In Crackdown In Gujarat
content: More than 1,000 illegal Bangladeshi immigrants, including women and children, were detained following combing operations in Ahmedabad and Surat, and efforts were underway for their deportation, Minister of State for Home Harsh Sanghavi said.

title: Exams postponed as question papers ‘fail to arrive’ in Kannur varsity
content: Students had received answer sheets and were seated in examination halls. They were kept waiting for over an hour before learning that the exams have been postponed

title: Safety survey held at Konni elephant training centre ahead of reopening
content: Centre has remained closed following the death of a four-year old boy in an accident on April 18. Safety inspection flags many flaws which will be rectified in two days. Plans afoot to open the centre on May 1

title: Security intensified in Kurnool and Nandyal
content: Security checks were conducted at vulnerable and sensitive places and places where people gather in large numbers

title: Mob attacks police station in Bihar's Katihar; Five policemen injured
content: Five people have been arrested in connection with the attack...The injured policemen were taken to the nearest government hospital where their condition is reported to be out of danger

title: After 5 years, Kailash Mansarovar Yatra to resume in June this year
content: After a five-year hiatus due to the pandemic and border tensions, India and China will resume the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra in June 2025. The pilgrimage, significant for Hindus, Jains, and Buddhists, will proceed through Lipulekh Pass in Uttarakhand and Nathu La in Sikkim. This resumption signals a positive step towards mending bilateral relations following recent diplomatic discussions and troop withdrawals.

title: 'Teaching lesson to hooligans a religion', says RSS chief
content: Mohan Bhagwat, the RSS chief, spoke about India's inherent non-violent nature. He stated that teaching a lesson becomes necessary when faced with evil. His comments follow the Pahalgam terrorist attack. Bhagwat emphasized the importance of unity within society. He added that strength must be visible when needed. He also mentioned that Hindus would never kill people after asking their religion.

title: Pakistan army chief does it again, says 'Muslims distinct from Hindus'
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, Pakistan's army chief, General Asim Munir, has reignited the two-nation theory, asserting the distinct nature of Muslims from Hindus across all facets of life. Munir emphasized Pakistan's resolve to defend itself, referencing actions taken by the Indian government after the attack. He also reiterated Pakistan's stance on Kashmir, referring to it as Pakistan's "jugular vein."

title: 'Tu mere jaisa nahin khel sakta ...': Rohit Sharma to young LSG batter
content: Rohit Sharma, known for his mentorship, shared invaluable batting advice with LSG's Abdul Samad, emphasising personalised technique and adaptability to varying conditions. He highlighted the importance of mindset and leveraging individual talent, rather than imitation. This guidance comes ahead of a crucial IPL clash between Mumbai Indians and Lucknow Super Giants, both vying for playoff contention.

title: 'Felt trapped & isolated': Rahul Gandhi on why he led Bharat Jodo Yatra
content: Rahul Gandhi stated that the Bharat Jodo Yatra was initiated due to the Congress party feeling politically stifled, citing compromised media access and an oppressive political environment. He emphasized the need for a new kind of politician to address challenges like concentrated capital and modern media. Gandhi also highlighted the importance of education, healthcare, and democratic space.

title: 'Kya re hero': Rohit Sharma's brutal roast goes viral - Watch
content: Ahead of their crucial match, Rohit Sharma's playful banter with Shardul Thakur during net practice has enlivened the Mumbai Indians camp. With both MI and LSG tied at 10 points, the upcoming clash at Wankhede is vital for playoff aspirations.

title: In a first, Russia confirms North Korean soldiers in Ukraine
content: Russia confirmed North Korean soldiers aided in liberating the Kursk region from Ukrainian control, a claim made by Chief of Staff Valery Gerasimov to Vladimir Putin. Putin hailed the victory and the North Korean soldiers' "heroism." Zelenskyy met with Trump, discussing a ceasefire and lasting peace, hoping for a historic outcome.

title: 'Humiliating retreat': BJP mocks Pak army after TRF denies role in Pahalgam
content: The Resistance Front (TRF) has retracted its claim of responsibility for the Pahalgam attack, attributing the initial message to a cyberattack orchestrated by India. The BJP mocked Pakistan's army, highlighting the terror outfit's fear due to India's stringent measures. Amid rising tensions, Pakistan offered a neutral probe into the attack, while Indian forces intensified anti-terror operations, detaining 175 suspects.

title: Rinku Singh reveals Dhoni's advice behind his calm finishing role
content: Rinku Singh acknowledges MS Dhoni's guidance for maintaining composure during high-pressure moments. He emphasises fitness and mental fortitude for IPL consistency. Singh learns from Andre Russell's power-hitting techniques. He believes that scoring 300 runs in an IPL match is achievable. Punjab previously chased down 262 runs. Singh highlights the strength of all teams this season.

title: 'Not in favour of war': CM Siddaramaiah on India-Pak tension; BJP hits back
content: Karnataka's Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has expressed his opposition to war with Pakistan amidst escalating tensions following the Pahalgam terror attack, advocating for strengthened security measures in Kashmir. He also affirmed his government's commitment to deporting Pakistani nationals residing in Karnataka, as directed by the central government.

title: 'Jadeja's strike rate is useless': Sehwag slams CSK batting approach
content: Chennai Super Kings suffered their seventh defeat in IPL 2025, losing to Sunrisers Hyderabad by five wickets at Chepauk, marking their fourth consecutive home loss. CSK's batting faltered, managing only 154 runs, with only Ayush Mhatre and Dewald Brevis showing resistance. Virender Sehwag criticised CSK's batting order and lack of responsibility, highlighting the absence of consistent scoring.

title: Employment In India Grown Faster Than Working-Age Population: World Bank
content: The report also highlighted a rise in self-employment, particularly among rural workers and women. A growing number of individuals are opting to work for themselves rather than taking on regular jobs.

title: 6 Sanitation Workers Killed, 5 Injured In Road Accident On Delhi-Mumbai Expressway
content: In a devastating incident on Saturday morning, six sanitation workers lost their lives and five others sustained critical injuries after a speeding pickup van crashed into them while they were cleaning a stretch of the Delhi-Mumbai Expressway.

title: Updates: Pope Francis' Funeral Underway, Over 200,000 People Attend
content: Pope Francis died at the age of 88 on April 21 due to a stroke, weeks after he returned home after battling double pneumonia.

title: Attempt To Grope Breasts 'Aggravated Sex Assault' But 'Not Rape': Calcutta High Court
content: The bench ordered that the operation of the order of conviction and sentence shall remain suspended till the disposal of the appeal or until further orders.

title: Kailash Mansarovar Yatra To Take Place Between June-August: Foreign Ministry
content: The much-awaited Kailash Mansarovar Yatra will take place between June to August 2025, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) announced on Saturday.

title: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap Ordered To Appear Before Surat Court Amid Brahmin Remark Row
content: After a complaint was filed against filmmaker and actor Anurag Kashyap for his controversial remark regarding the Brahmin community, the JMFC court in Surat has issued a notice against Mr Kashyap, ordering him to appear in court on May 7.

title: High Court Charges AR Rahman, 'Ponniyin Selvan 2' Makers Rs 2 Crore In Copyright Case
content: The Delhi High Court has directed acclaimed music composer AR Rahman and the makers of the film 'Ponniyin Selvan 2' to deposit Rs 2 crore with the court following a copyright lawsuit over Junior Dagar brothers' classical rendition of 'Shiv Stuti'.

title: Sahitya Akademi condoles demise of historian MGS Narayanan
content: Prof. Narayanan’s passing marks the loss of a powerful presence in the realm of historical research in Kerala as well as a meaningful voice in its socio-cultural landscape, says a statement by the Kerala Sahitya Akademi

title: Concern over declining admissions in mathematics, pure sciences undergraduate courses
content: According to a survey, Bachelor of Commerce (B.Com) is the most popular choice  followed by B. Com Computer Application and Bachelor of Business Administration

title: Chandrababu Naidu promises steps to improve the lot of fishermen in Andhra Pradesh
content: He launches Matsyakara Bharosa scheme under which ₹20,000 financial assistance is provided to each eligible fishermen family during the fishing holiday period; the construction of 11 fishing harbours will be completed in one year, he adds

title: Collector calls for action plan to address sanitation, drinking water, and fodder crisis in Annamayya district
content: Sridhar Chamakuri criticises the poor waste management and cautions officials to rectify the issues immediately following an inspection of the dumpyard at Peddamandyam

title: M.G.S. Narayanan and the 10 tall tales that he wanted erased from Kerala history
content: ‘Myths’ on Parasurama, St. Thomas, and Tipu Sultan, which have gone unchallenged, should be discarded in favour of honesty in historical research, the historian said in a compilation of such tales

title: Traders association pleads for regular train services between Chennai and Tiruvarur
content: The Tiruvarur Vijayapuram Varthagar Sangam writes to the Divisional Railway Manager, Tiruchi, and seeks introduction of a day train on the line

title: Mumbai police question Tahawwur Rana for 8 hours; say he gave evasive answers, didn't cooperate
content: Rana, a 64-year-old Pakistani-origin Canadian businessman, was extradited from the USA for his alleged role in the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks earlier this month

title: Modest rise in bird diversity recorded in Kottayam  town
content: Survey team divides city into five sectors. Highest number of bird sightings reported on CMS College campus, followed by Eerayil Kadavu. Other surveyed locations include Nagampadom Stadium area, Collectorate premises, and PWD Rest House

title: Civil services exam topper Shakti Dubey scores 51.5%; UPSC releases score cards
content: Second-rank achiever Harshita Goyal has scored 1,038 marks (51.28%) — 851 in the main exam and 187 in the interview

title: 'MS Dhoni aisa auction nahi kar sakta tha': Raina blasts CSK
content: Suresh Raina has criticised Chennai Super Kings after their recent loss to Sunrisers Hyderabad. Raina questioned the team's auction strategies and player performances. He highlighted MS Dhoni's continued dedication despite the team's struggles. Raina suggested that Dhoni's absence from key decision-making has hurt the team. Sunrisers Hyderabad defeated CSK, further jeopardising their playoff chances.

title: Content Creator Misha Agrawal passes away two days ahead of her 25th birthday
content: Content creator Misha Agrawal has tragically passed away, just two days shy of her 25th birthday, as confirmed by her family on Instagram. Known for her positive and relatable content, Misha's sudden death has sparked an outpouring of grief and heartfelt tributes from her devoted followers and the wider digital community.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Agencies name 14 active local terrorists in J&K
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, intelligence agencies have identified 14 local terrorists active in Jammu and Kashmir, aged 20 to 40. These operatives, linked to Hizbul Mujahideen, LeT, and JeM, provide crucial support to Pakistani militants. Security forces have initiated joint operations in South Kashmir to disrupt terror support systems and prevent future attacks.

title: Al-Qaeda operatives among 1,024 illegal Bangladeshis arrested in Gujarat
content: Following a terror attack in Kashmir, Gujarat Police initiated a large-scale operation targeting illegal Bangladeshi residents. Hundreds were arrested across the state, with investigations revealing links to criminal activities, including suspected Al-Qaeda operatives. Authorities are intensifying operations, warning illegal residents to surrender, and focusing on exposing terror links and fake document networks.

title: Govt to desilt rivers for storage to prevent water flow to Pak
content: India is set to implement its decision regarding the Indus Waters Treaty. Amit Shah chaired a meeting to finalize the implementation roadmap. The plan includes desilting rivers and dams as an immediate step. India aims to create additional water storage and speed up hydro-power projects. The goal is to maximize the use of western rivers' water within India.

title: Possible underwater UFO base discovered off California coast
content: An underwater structure, Sycamore Knoll, sparks alien base theories. It disappeared from Google Earth but remains on fishing apps. UFO sightings are reported near the site. Military insiders share accounts of fast-moving underwater objects. Declassified footage shows a craft rising from the ocean. These events link to past UFO encounters off Southern California.

title: 7 dead, 4 critical as speeding van mows down group on Delhi-Mumbai Expressway
content: An accident on the Delhi-Mumbai Expressway in Nuh district claimed the lives of seven sanitation workers, including six women, after a speeding van ran them over. Four others sustained critical injuries and were rushed to a Delhi hospital. The victims were cleaning the road near Ibrahimvas village when the incident occurred, leading to a major traffic disruption and a police investigation.

title: 26/11 terror attack accused Rana not cooperating with investigation: Police
content: Tahawwur Hussain Rana, a key figure in the 26/11 Mumbai attacks, is reportedly not cooperating with investigators, offering evasive answers during questioning. An Indian court denied Rana's request to speak with his family, citing concerns about potential information leaks.

title: In a shift away from China, 70-80 million iPhones to be made in India soon
content: Apple is significantly increasing iPhone production in India, aiming for 70-80 million units by late 2026, potentially making India the primary supplier to the US. This shift, driven by diversification and geopolitical factors, could see India manufacturing nearly 40% of global iPhones.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Medic was shot before he could ID self as Nepalese
content: Sudeep Neupane, a 27-year-old Nepali citizen, was tragically killed in the Pahalgam terror attack. Mistaken for an Indian Hindu, he was shot before he could clarify his nationality. His body was repatriated to his hometown in Butwal, Nepal, after a journey across India.

title: Harshal Patel: From working at a perfume store to disguising IPL batters
content: On Friday, Harshal Patel snared four wickets as Sunrisers Hyderabad defeated five-time champions Chennai Super Kings by five-wickets in a must-win game for the Pat Cummins-led side. With 13 wickets in eight games, Harshal has been the lone consistent performer for the hot-and-cold Sunrisers' outfit.

title: 'MS Dhoni is already thinking about ... ': CSK veteran drops bombshell
content: Following Chennai Super Kings' continued struggles in IPL 2025, Ambati Rayudu suggests the team needs to adapt to modern T20 cricket. Despite some bright spots from Brevis and Mhatre, Rayudu believes significant squad changes are necessary for next season. He also anticipates an exciting clash between Shreyas Iyer's Punjab Kings and Kolkata Knight Riders, favoring Punjab as strong playoff contenders.

title: Southern Railway to demolish old bridge near Fort Station in Tiruchi
content: The Tiruchi Corporation is expected to take over the work after the demolition and the complete the entire work, taken up at a construction of ₹34.10 crore before November

title: Police trace missing Vizag woman at Tirumala
content: Tirumala police act swiftly following a phone call from her family and spot her in queue complex based on CCTV footage

title: 58 women entrepreneurs undergo training in value addition of organic foods
content: A two-day programme was organised at the  National Institute for Food Technology, Entrepreneurship and Management, Thanjavur, under a Central scheme

title: Demand grows for creation of separate police sub-division in Thuraiyur
content: At present, Thuraiyur falls under the jurisdiction of the Musiri police sub-division; the jurisdiction is spread over a vast area bordering Namakkal, Salem, and Perambalur districts

title: Two decades on, Arthunkal harbour development remains a distant dream
content: The stalled project got a fresh lease of life after  Centre gave nod for its development. However, State government is yet to approve tender excess quoted by lowest bidder

title: NCW takes up complaints of harassment of women teachers in Mathura
content: The National Commission for Women expressed strong disapproval over alleged misconduct by a Basic Shiksha Adhikari, terming the actions as ‘misuse of official position’ and ‘violation of women’s rights’

title: Centre admitted to security lapse in terror attack in Pahalgam: Kharge
content: However, the Congress has decided to support the Centre in the interest of the nation and the party has supported the government’s decision, he said

title: ₹10 lakh ex gratia announced for kin of elephant attack victim in A.P.
content: Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan assures that all necessary measures will be taken to prevent loss of life in human-animal conflict

title: Meet Usha Vance's lesser-known yet brilliant sister, Shreya Chilukuri
content: Usha Vance, an Indian-American, is gaining prominence alongside her husband, US Vice President JD Vance. While Usha navigates political life, her sister, Shreya Chilukuri, excels in engineering. A Duke University graduate, Shreya contributed to missile development at Raytheon and now works at ASML, a leading semiconductor company.

title: 'Not interested in playing in India': Pakistan cricketer sparks controversy
content: Amidst heightened tensions following the Pahalgam attack, Pakistan's Gull Feroza confirmed their women's cricket team will not play in India during the upcoming World Cup. Echoing PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi's stance, Feroza stated a preference for Asian conditions, suggesting Sri Lanka or Dubai as potential neutral venues. Earlier this year, the Indian men's team also declined to travel to Pakistan for the Champions Trophy. As a result, their matches—including the final—were held in Dubai.

title: ‘Drown in it’: Delhi min's fiery retort to Bhutto's threat on Indus waters treaty
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack and India's suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, Delhi minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa strongly criticized Pakistan's Bilawal Bhutto-Zardari's threats. Sirsa condemned Pakistan's support for terrorism and warned its officials against provocative actions, as protests erupted in London over the killings. The escalating tensions highlight the strained relationship between the two nations.

title: MS Dhoni finally loses cool after CSK loss, says 'you can't just keep ... '
content: Mahendra Singh Dhoni expressed disappointment as Chennai Super Kings suffered a five-wicket defeat against Sunrisers Hyderabad, further diminishing their IPL 2025 play-off hopes. Dhoni felt that their score of 154 was inadequate on the Chepauk pitch, and the team's overall performance lacked cohesion. ​​CSK, meanwhile, sit at the bottom with just two wins from nine games and only four points to show.

title: Need of the hour is not war but strict measures to strengthen security in Kashmir valley: Siddaramaiah
content: “We are not in favour of war. We want peace and security for the people. Centre should take steps to tighten security,” he said

title: Campaign for Rohith Vemula Act writes to CM Siddaramaiah with suggestions
content: The letter suggests that the government open up the drafting process in compliance with the pre-legislative consultation policy of 2014.

title: Jammu & Kashmir Minister Sakina Itoo raises issue of security of people from State with Punjab Governor
content: The purpose of these visits is to coordinate efforts with the respective State Governments and ensure the safety and well-being of Jammu & Kashmir residents

title: Role of veterinarians hailed at World Veterinary Day in Rayachoti
content: Veterinarians are the lifeline of the dairy sector. Honoring them and recognising their services remain the responsibility of all in society, Joint Collector said

title: Six sanitation workers killed, five injured after being hit by vehicle on Delhi Mumbai Expressway in Gurugram
content: The accident took place around 10 a.m. when about 11 sanitation workers were cleaning the expressway. Suddenly, a speeding pickup vehicle hit the workers and six of them died on the spot, they said.

title: T.N. CM Stalin announces hike in monthly, family pensions of former MLAs and MLCs
content: Responding to a request by Deputy Speaker K. Pitchandi and another member Poovai Jagan Moorthy, the Chief Minister said the MLAs’ monthly pension will be increased to ₹35,000 from ₹30,000

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Houses razed, hundreds detained in massive crackdown in Kashmir
content: The security forces are going after the known terrorist associates and their sympathisers across the length and breadth of the Valley

title: New Thiran initiative to improve students’ proficiency: T.N. School Education Minister
content: At a cost of ₹19 crore, students of Classes VI-VIII at government schools would be given coaching during school hours

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Omar Abdullah questions Pakistan's offer to join 'neutral' probe
content: "First they (Pakistan) did not accept that something happened in Pahalgam. Then they even said it was done by India. They were the ones who first accused us, so it's difficult to say anything about them," Omar Abdullah said

title: Andhra Pradesh government swaps ‘Swachh Andhra’ themes for May and June to tackle seasonal challenges
content: Beat the Heat would be the theme for May instead of June and Neeru-Meeru would  be taken up in June instead of May, in view of the climatic conditions, Principal Secretary said

title: I&B Ministry advises media to refrain from live coverage of defence operations
content: Amid reports of plans to carry out major anti-terrorist operations, the advisory cautioned specifically against real-time coverage, dissemination of visuals, or reporting from ‘sources-based’ information related to defence operations or movement

title: Terrorist hideout busted, huge cache of arms seized in J&K's Kupwara: Police
content: A significant cache of arms and ammunition, including five AK-47 rifles, eight AK-47 magazines, a pistol, a pistol magazine, 660 rounds of AK-47 ammunition, a pistol round and 50 rounds of M4 ammunition, was seized from the site

title: India skirts maritime border dispute with Pakistan by fresh continental-shelf claim
content: This gives them rights to commercially mine for valuable minerals, polymetallic nodules and oil reserves.

title: Victims of Ramban flash floods not forgotten amid govt's focus on terror attack: J&K CM Omar
content: I came to Ramban, met my colleagues and the people from the district administration and took a look at the situation, says J&K CM Omar Abdullah

title: KTR asks Rahul Gandhi to visit Lagcherla, Kancha Gachibowli, victims of HYDRAA demolitions
content: BRS MLA Kavitha wants answers from Rahul on six guarantees stating that most of them remain unfulfilled yet

title: ‘Cash transactions worth ₹1.30 lakh crore were done in liquor shops to facilitate looting of public exchequer’
content: Multiple national and international brand distilleries were closed as their proprietors refused to pay commissions to liquor businessmen who had the backing of YSRCP, the TDP leader charged

title: Dhinakaran holds DMK government responsible for blast at fireworks unit in Virudhunagar
content: An explosion at a fireworks unit in Virudhunagar district on Saturday (April 26, 2025) left three persons dead and seven injured

title: Three workers killed, seven sustain burns in blast at fireworks unit near Sivakasi
content: A senior fire officer supervising the rescue operation said that improper handling of chemicals may have caused the spark and subsequent fire

title: Living in Odisha for three decades, woman with Pakistani passport faces heartbreaking deportation
content: Sharada Kukreja, married for 35 years and part of a close-knit family, pleads to remain with her loved ones

title: Kailash Mansarovar yatra to begin end-June: MEA
content: Pilgrimage to Tibet to resume after six-year gap, following several rounds of India-China negotiations after the LAC detente; 250 yatris to travel via Lipulekh pass, 500 to travel via Nathu La pass through Gangtok

title: Enforcement Directorate unearths land scam of ₹1,000 crore in Goa
content: An official said searches were conducted based on intelligence and subsequent financial investigation, which revealed that Rohan Harmalkar is a key mastermind

title: T.N. Deputy CM introduces Bill to prevent coercive recovery by money lending entities
content: Mr. Udhayanidhi said it was necessary to provide a statutory framework to protect economically weaker and vulnerable groups from the undue hardship caused by coercive recovery methods used by money lending entities

title: Pinarayi Vijayan says MGS defended history against attempts at appropriation by the rightwing
content: MGS opened a new window on history writing that was different from that of administrators and language experts, says Pinarayi Vijayan

title: Bill to amend Goondas Act introduced in Tamil Nadu Assembly
content: Though the Bill bore the name of Electricity, Prohibition and Excise Minister V. Senthilbalaji, who was present in the House, Law Minister S. Regupathy introduced it in the Assembly

title: MGS a key force behind the Muziris project, says Satheesan
content: Leader of the Opposition in the Kerala Assembly recalls historian M.G.S. Narayanan as a key force behind the Muziris Heritage Project, despite theoretical objections

title: Sanders remains undrafted as free fall continues
content: Shedeur Sanders remains undrafted entering the fourth round of the NFL draft. Coverage resumes Saturday at noon ET on ESPN.

title: Payton: 'Beware' if you snubbed Sanders in draft
content: Broncos coach Sean Payton said teams that passed over Shedeur Sanders in the NFL draft should "beware" because the ex-Colorado QB will use the snub as motivation.

title: Celts vent after loss: Refs not controlling play
content: Through three games of this first-round series, the seventh-seeded Magic have displayed a physical style of basketball that the defending champion Celtics say they believe is over the line.

title: Harmon's mom died after Steelers picked her son
content: Tiffany Saine, the mother of Steelers first-round pick Derrick Harmon, died Thursday night shortly after her son was selected No. 21 in the NFL draft.

title: Saints invest in QB room, draft Shough at 40
content: The Saints bypassed Sanders for the second time in as many nights Friday, selecting Louisville's Tyler Shough with the 40th pick in the NFL draft.

title: Sapped by stomach bug, Luka struggles in G3 loss
content: A visibly ill Luka Doncic played through a stomach ailment and was limited to 17 points in a 116-104 Game 3 loss to the Wolves.

title: Boone to mull Yanks' closer as Williams flops again
content: Devin Williams' continued struggles in the ninth prompted Yankees manager Aaron Boone to say "we'll see" when asked if the team would consider making a switch at closer.

title: Taylor, Hall of Fame DE's son, drafted by Jets
content: The Jets selected Mason Taylor, the son of Hall of Famer Jason Taylor, in the second round of the NFL draft.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Senators on the brink, while Avs, Knights, Bolts try to punch back
content: Get ready for Saturday's four games with key stats, matchups, more. Plus, Friday's Three Stars and highlights.

title: 'There's no drop-off down there': How the bottom of the order is powering the Cubs' offense to top of MLB

title: Luka, LeBron and the most dangerous 60-foot passes in the game
content: These mega-outlets illustrate a growing Lakers connection that should strike fear across the NBA. And they're only going to happen more.

title: Madrid to play Copa final despite protest over refs
content: Real Madrid denied they were considering boycotting Saturday's Copa del Rey final against Barcelona, despite protesting comments made by the refereeing team.

title: Senator wants travel policies eased before '26 WC
content: Sen. Ron Wyden of Oregon has asked top Trump administration officials to reconsider policies that are impacting travelers arriving in the United States, citing upcoming sporting events like the 2026 World Cup.

title: Pride stage late comeback, avoid 2nd straight loss
content: Defending NWSL champions Orlando Pride rallied with three goals in the last 20 minutes to secure a 3-2 victory and avoid consecutive defeats after ending their 23-game unbeaten streak last week.

title: Evra eyes Suárez MMA fight: 'He can even bite me'
content: Former Manchester United defender Patrice Evra will make his debut as an MMA fighter in a "showcase bout" on May 23 in Paris, the PFL has announced.

title: Reynolds: Wrexham promotion bid given me ulcer
content: Wrexham co-owner Ryan Reynolds has said the crucial last weeks of Wrexham's bid for promotion have developed "an eight-inch ulcer in my stomach."

title: Nice end PSG's hopes of unbeaten Ligue 1 season
content: Paris Saint-Germain's hopes of becoming the first side to complete a Ligue 1 season unbeaten came crashing down at the Parc des Princes on Friday when Nice handed them their first defeat of the league campaign.

title: Chelsea-bound Estêvão scores, vomits in Copa win
content: Palmeiras' Estêvão had an 18th birthday to remember, netting the club's second goal in a 3-2 Copa Libertadores win over Bolivar before dropping to the turf, vomiting and leaving the field on a stretcher as the high altitude of La Paz took its toll.
